title: GE Warns Supply-Chain Issues to Pressure Profits, Cash Flow
sub_head: Shares fall after manufacturer says labor and inflation also weighing on results
body:
General Electric Co. warned that supply-chain problems, labor shortages and inflation would weigh on its financial results in the first half of the year.
The disclosure Friday, in a newsletter for GE investors, sent shares of the industrial giant down about 5% in afternoon trading. GE shares are trading around $94, little changed from a year ago, after adjusting for a reverse stock split.
